value.title: SCOTUS gave Trump leeway on executive actions. Biden wants the same treatment
value.excerpt: The Biden administration faces two major confrontations with the Supreme Court this week, as the justices weigh requests related to the Covid moratorium on evictions and the termination of a Trump practice that forced migrants seeking US asylum to stay in Mexico until their claims could be heard.

value.title: Possible Havana syndrome incident delayed Harris flight to Vietnam
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris' departure for Vietnam was delayed by several hours Tuesday afternoon after her office was informed by the US embassy in Hanoi, Vietnam, of a "report of a recent possible anomalous health incident."

value.title: Hostile Trump mob sends GOP Rep. Brooks into panicked backpedal on moving on from 2020
value.excerpt: Rachel Maddow shares video of Republican Congressman Mo Brooks being roundly booed by the audience at a Donald Trump rally in Alabama after Brooks suggested they move on from Trump's 2020 loss and focus on future elections.

value.title: Why is Joe Biden suing Facebook and Instagram over vaccine posts?
value.excerpt: Facebook is back in hot water after an explosive New York Times investigative report found the company hid the truth about its most popular viral content after the company discovered the most-viewed link on the platform raised doubt about the coronavirus vaccine.

value.title: Afghanistan fallout engulfs Harris' first day of Southeast Asia trip
value.excerpt: Vice President Kamala Harris, undertaking a suddenly high-stakes visit to Southeast Asia this week amid the first major foreign policy crisis of the Biden administration, was on the receiving end of questions Monday about the US' withdrawal from Afghanistan for the first time since the chaotic fall of

value.title: Analysis: Why Biden's Afghanistan exit wasn't about good politics
value.excerpt: In ending America's longest war, President Joe Biden did something popular. It was never going to help him politically.

value.title: Fact check: Trump administration officials try to rewrite their own Afghanistan history
value.excerpt: There's been no shortage of fact-based criticism aimed at the Biden administration's handling of the US withdrawal from Afghanistan.

value.title: Former Pence aide says Trump and Miller stymied Afghan refugee efforts.
value.excerpt: Olivia Troye recalled sitting in meetings where Stephen Miller, Mr. Trump’s top immigration adviser, demanded restrictions on refugees, including those from Afghanistan and Iraq.

value.title: Trump heads to Alabama but his Covid politics are everywhere
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump still towers over the GOP, and he's set to appear Saturday at an Alabama rally. And ambitious Republicans eyeing future White House bids are increasingly emulating his brand of confrontational, fact-challenged politics on Covid.

value.title: President and first lady plan to get their Covid booster shots when eligible, Biden says
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden and first lady Jill Biden plan to get Covid-19 vaccine booster shots once they are cleared to take them, the President said in an interview aired Thursday.

value.title: Fareed Zakaria: This withdrawal is a stain on Biden's foreign policy
value.excerpt: CNN's Anderson Cooper talks with Fareed Zakaria about the crisis unfolding in Afghanistan and what this means for President Joe Biden's foreign policy. Watch "Full Circle" Monday, Wednesday and Friday 6p E.T.

value.title: Title, cover and details of new Trump book from Bob Woodward, Robert Costa
value.excerpt: First it was "Fear," then it was "Rage," now it is "Peril." That is the title of the highly-anticipated third book about President Trump from legendary journalist Bob Woodward, this time written with co-author Robert Costa, a Washington Post national political reporter.

value.title: Biden administration struggles to project order as Taliban enters Kabul
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden and his administration struggled Sunday to project order amid a race by American and other foreign personnel to evacuate Afghanistan as Taliban fighters entered Kabul.

value.title: How the 2020 census explains Donald Trump
value.excerpt: Donald Trump got it.

value.title: Bad News for ‘Trump-Adjacent Weirdos’ Delights Seth Meyers
value.excerpt: Meyers enjoyed seeing Mike Lindell get word on camera that a defamation suit against him over his claims of election fraud would proceed.

value.title: Pennsylvania congressman aided Trump effort to flip Justice Department on Big Lie
value.excerpt: While other Republicans garnered more attention in attempting to convince the country that the 2020 election was stolen from former President Donald Trump, Rep. Scott Perry made the critical connection linking the then-president to Jeffrey Clark, a little-known Department of Justice official open to

value.title: Biden on anti-mask ordinances: 'This isn't about politics -- this is about keeping our children safe'
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden on Thursday hit out at anti-masking protesters for politicizing the Covid-19 pandemic, saying he was particularly disturbed by scenes at a school board meeting in Tennessee earlier this week.

value.title: Biden forges ahead where Trump and Obama failed on infrastructure and Afghanistan
value.excerpt: Every president since George W. Bush has said it's time to leave Afghanistan and turn to nation building at home.

value.title: Kamala Harris invites business leaders to the White House to discuss child care.
value.excerpt: Executives from companies like Airbnb, Chobani, Etsy and Microsoft were invited in an effort to drum up support for a key pillar of President Biden's $3.5 trillion budget.

value.title: House Democrats can get some of Trump's tax records from accounting firm Mazars USA, judge rules
value.excerpt: The US House should be able to access some of Donald Trump's tax records through a subpoena to his accounting firm Mazars USA, a federal judge in Washington, DC, ruled on Wednesday.

value.title: Biden nominates Elizabeth Prelogar to be solicitor general
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden on Wednesday nominated acting US Solicitor General Elizabeth Prelogar to permanently take on the role of representing the US government in cases before the Supreme Court.

value.title: Federal prosecutors came to suspect Trump Org CFO Allen Weisselberg lied
value.excerpt: New York federal prosecutors came to suspect the Trump Organization's chief financial officer, Allen Weisselberg, lied in testimony during their investigation of former Trump personal attorney Michael Cohen three years ago, according to four people familiar with prosecutors' thinking.

value.title: Biden on Cuomo's resignation: 'I respect the governor's decision'
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden said Tuesday that he respects New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo's decision to resign after the President called on Cuomo to step down last week following an official report that said Cuomo sexually harassed multiple women.

value.title: Biden: $1 trillion infrastructure bill ‘will transform America’
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden called the $1 trillion infrastructure bill “historic” and said that it will “transform America.” The bill will make a huge investment in nation’s roads, public transit, water and broadband.

value.title: Trump's acting attorney general revealed 'frightening' activity at Justice Department, Senate Judiciary chair says
value.excerpt: Senate Judiciary Chairman Dick Durbin said Sunday that former acting Attorney General Jeffrey Rosen revealed in testimony this weekend "frightening" information about what had occurred at the Justice Department during the waning days of the Trump administration.

value.title: Bidens to meet virtually with Team USA athletes
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden and first lady Jill Biden will meet with members of the 2020 US Olympic Team Saturday in a livestreamed virtual reception.

value.title: Fact-checking claim Biden administration is pushing vaccine passport
value.excerpt: Amid confusion over mask mandates, booster shots, and new guidance for those vaccinated, some Republicans have thrown fuel on the fire with false and misleading claims.

value.title: 9/11 families tell Biden to stay away from memorial service if he doesn't authorize release of records related to attacks
value.excerpt: More than 1,600 people affected by the September 11 attacks are asking President Joe Biden to refrain from coming to Ground Zero to mark the 20th anniversary of the event unless he releases documents and information related to the attacks, according to a letter released by the group.

value.title: The Point: You shouldn't miss this massive bombshell in Trump's ongoing election fraud lie
value.excerpt: Unless you have been living on another planet for the past six months, you know by now that Donald Trump leaned on state and national officials in the final days of his presidency to force investigations into made-up claims of widespread election fraud in the 2020 race.

value.title: Biden to announce new emissions standards, target that 50% of vehicles sold in US by 2030 are electric
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden will sign an executive order Thursday that points the US auto market toward electric vehicles, announcing a new target that half of vehicles sold in the country by 2030 will be battery electric, fuel-cell electric or plug-in hybrid.
